summary: Multiple endocrine neoplasia (MEN) encompasses several distinct syndromes characterized by tumors of endocrine glands, each with its own pattern. Tumors can be malignant or benign. Benign or malignant tumors of nonendocrine tissues can also occur. MEN syndromes are inherited as autosomal dominant disorders.
symptoms: Endocrinopathy of two characteristic affected organs
Endocrinopathy of one characteristic organ plus a first-degree relative affected by MEN syndrome
diagnosis: Genetic testing for MEN1 gene mutations
Genetic testing for RET oncogene mutations
Clinical evaluation for endocrinopathy of characteristic organs
